Key Match Events: Italy went behind after 12 seconds but came back to beat France 3-1 in a highly entertaining Nations League Group A2 opening game.
Bradley Barcola found the net in the opening minute when he caught Giovanni Di Lorenzo napping and raced into the area before curling a shot past Gianluigi Donnarumma.
Italy levelled after half an hour with Federico Dimarco volleying home a deft backheel pass from Sandro Tonali.
Davide Frattesi put Italy ahead five minutes after the interval.
Giacomo Raspadori gave the visitors the breathing space they needed in the 74th minute.
Luciano Spalletti praised Sandro Tonali's performance, saying he gave two good bursts and found a very strong player again.
Post-Match Reflections: Italy manager Luciano Spalletti expressed satisfaction with the team's performance, praising Sandro Tonali's contribution.
